metadata.title: CVE-2019-0220 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.0 to 2.4.38. When thepath component of a request URL contains multiple consecutive slashes('/'), directives such as LocationMatch and RewriteRule must account forduplicates in regular expressions while other aspects of the serversprocessing will implicitly collapse them.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-0220` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.6
apache2-bin - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.6
apache2-data - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.6
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.6
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.6
apache2-utils - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.29-1ubuntu4.6').
